Click To View Slideshow Â» For a sane experience, here are some tech-related behaviors to avoid while traveling. 
Memorial Day weekend is upon us! But unless you live in a beach-front condo or lakeside villa, chances are you're hopping in a plane, train, or automobile for some warm weather fun. 
Before you can crack open a beer or throw a burger on the grill, many of you will get to enjoy the best the TSA has to offer , and then get cozy with a stranger in a metal tube for a few hours. Unless you've nabbed some fancy pants First Class action, though, it's an unpleasant experience. No sir, that 40-pound suitcase won't fit in the overhead bin. That's a nice pedicure, ma'am, but could you not put your hooves on my armrest? Runaway drink cart coming through, gunning for your elbows! 
Yes, people are terrible . And that's before we get to what they do with their technology. I'm looking at you, Alec . But in the spirit of a sane experience, and not getting dragged off an aircraft by Homeland Security, here are some tech-related behaviors to avoid while traveling with your fellow humans.
